ai.summary: Stage 05 of the London to Walsingham route covers 57.5 km across varied countryside in the UK. This hard stage demands good endurance, navigation, and preparation as walkers traverse rural lanes, hedgerows, and mixed terrain toward Walsingham.
ai.terrain_summary: The route features a mix of rural pavements, farm tracks, hedged lanes, and uneven footpaths. Expect a combination of grassy fields, minor elevation changes, mud after rain, and occasional road crossings. Navigation relies on public rights of way; daylight and weather can affect footing and visibility.
ai.safety_notes: Plan for a long day with possible fatigue. Check weather forecasts and daylight hours. Carry a map or GPS, compass, and a charged phone. Stay hydrated and fueled; wear sturdy footwear and be prepared for mud. Road awareness near villages, livestock, and gate/stream crossings. Inform someone of your intended timetable and route.
recommended_gear: Layered clothing plus waterproof outer shell
Navigation tools: map and compass or GPS
Headlamp or flashlight with extra batteries
Water bottle or hydration system (2â€“3 liters)
High-energy snacks and a small first aid kit
ai.best_seasons: Spring and autumn are ideal for this stage due to milder weather and better ground conditions; summer offers long daylight but can be hot and dusty; winter increases mud and reduces daylight.

seo.title: London to Walsingham - Stage 05 (57.5 km) - UK Long Distance Walk
seo.meta_description: Stage 5 of the London to Walsingham route: a challenging 57.5 km hike through varied UK countryside with practical safety, terrain, and gear guidance.
seo.h1: London to Walsingham - Stage 05: 57.5 km Hard Hike
